reviews.review_msg: Best prof to take BPK 142 with. Lectures have lots of info but he presents it clear and heavily hints at exam questions & basically tells you exactly what to study. Lectures can be a bit long but he does make it interesting. The labs are a good grade boost. Make sure to take lots of time to review as it is a lot of material.

His lectures are clear and easy to follow. There is a lot of content in his slides so get ready to take notes and review every week. He also has lecture and lab quizzes so make sure to pay attention to his lectures. The marking for exams and labs are a bit tough, if you consistently review each topic you should be fine. Overall, approachable prof.
Ask him questions and he'll answer in quite a simple way. Somewhat funny as well.

His lectures are engaging however they are very long and can be draining. There's a good balance of heavy and light content that he covers. Lecture exams were very difficult because there is a lot of content you need to remember. Lab exams were more manageable. His slides and notes were very good for studying.
I love him! he's such a great prof and engaging! explains things in depth and well.

studying as you go is the key to this class, don't fall behind or you'll get overwhelmed. i wouldn't recommend this as an elective (unless you like anatomy) as there's so much content to cover. jim is a great lecturer and explains things very well. definitely go to your TA if you need any help!! [fall 2021]
The online course format was not supportive for students

Professor Carter was kind but not a great teacher. The lectures consisted of him saying the same stuff he already said in very long videos he had already posted before in which he would just read off the slides. The class was cool but was not very engaging which did not help with staying productive throughout the course.
I took BPK 142 with professor Carter, he is truly passionate about what he teaches which made his classes very enjoyable. I loved the labs and the physiology portion of his class. Great prof

amazing professor. he explains things very well both in lec and the prerecorded vids. you can get by without even going to lec and just reading the provided notes and slides, however there are poll and post lec q's for small participation marks. def study bc it's quite a hard course. i don't recommend this as an elective.
i think hes a pretty fair marker and the exams arent too bad. you just need to memorize everything on the summary sheet for the exams.
Jim is a great guy, had Tiffany and Brent as T.A, they were also extremely helpful and attentive. Great materials.

He was probably one of the best profs I have ever had and he made 8:30 am lectures interesting. I would highly recommend taking bpk 142 with him as he made a relatively difficult course much more manageable.

This course is probably one of the hardest and heaviest course and I've grind through and i've done very well in 200 courses. The amount of materials covered is insane for a 3-credit 100 course and gave me more panic and stress than calc and physics combined.
Explains concepts clearly and is a well respected professor. BPK 142 is not an easy class and has a lot of content, but if you study regularly, it's not too difficult to get a good grade

Dr. Carter was absolutely fantastic! His lectures are clear, concise and very organized much like the rest of the course. You have to review the material regularly (I suggest making flashcards and looking at them everyday) to do well and make sure not to cram before the tests. If you're diligent with studying the material, an A isn't hard at all.

Jim is a wonderful professor! He is very hands on and will answer any questions you have. BPK 407 is a fun course and you get to learn a lot of very useful practical skills. The course is quite a bit of work between weekly quizzes and group projects but if you put the work in you will do well. Be creative with your project if you want to stand out!

BPK 142 is a dense course, and Jim understands that. He'll give you information on how to study during the midterm and exams. He's knowledgeable, and gives interesting lecture, even at 8:30 am. No textbook was needed. Study the lecture slides provided, and study for that lab midterm. A lot of people did badly on the lab midterm. Good luck

Truly passionate about the course material. He is very knowledgable as well. The lectures are amazing, but TA's have too much control over the grades you get. I didnt have a fair marking TA for this course, but Jim Carter himself is truly amazing. I would love to take another course with him if I could.
Really good prof he seems passionate about kinesiology and makes lectures interesting, but the class itself is pretty hard, a lot of memorization
Great Prof. Fair exams. Nice Person. Makes the class very straightforward

Jim is by far one of the best profs I have had at sfu. He tells you what information is going to be on the midterm and isn't actually lying like most other profs. He had notes of his lectures that contain all the testable material in the class. Very knowledgeable about the content and lectures are very much worth going to. A god amongst men.
My favourite prof this semester. All exams are super fair if you put a bit of effort into studying!

Jim is a clear and passionate professor towards the class material! The iclicker questions are for participation marks only, often relating to daily life outside the classroom. Exams were fair. However, there is a lot of material covered in the lecture and lab finals. Definitely study ahead!
Jim is such a cool dude. He makes a 4 hour lab somehow bearable. Highly Recommend!
very good prof. midterms and final was super fair. if you study all his lecture notes you should easily get an A. but prepare to work hard. would recommend this prof
Good prof with interesting lectures. He makes the material relatable, which helps. No surprises on the midterm and final exams, just a lot of content to memorize.
Amazing prof! He's really engaging and there are no surprises in the lecture and lab midterms or finals. The lecture final and midterm have lots of list type questions that are easy marks to get!

This class is not a good choice for a gpa booster as it is a heavy course and requires commitment. However Jim is a good prof and makes class interesting and is very knowledgeable. Exams are all pretty fair as you know what to expect for the lab exams.  Final exam was pretty easy (I think). A solid choice.

Jim was an amazing lecturer and made me motivated to come to class. His lectures were always organised and went along well with the lab component.  We were told exactly what to expect from assessments, and if you did the work for the class were very straightforward.  I highly recommend taking this course with Jim if you have the opportunity.
LOVE.

He says in lecture that the only thing he will test you on are the notes he provides. This is technically true, however in his tests he expects much more detail in the answer than the question would imply. So it's a good idea to, once you think you're done the test, go back through it and add things, even if you think they would be obvious.

THIS PROF WAS AWESOME. He had lecture notes ready for us (for this term, not sure about the future). His lectures were based on lecture notes, of course. But on top of that, he gave us extra details and visuals just to make sure we understood concepts better (which was GREAT and SO helpful). I would literally take any class he teaches.

Best teacher at SFU. What is going to be on the test is very clear. He goes over the key concepts in class and that is what he tests us on. Make sure you go to class and listen because that will be what is on the test.
Pretty good prof that tries to make lectures interesting and fun :) Midterm was surprising and not as in depth as expected.
Took BPK/KIN 140 with him in Summer 2015, he is a great prof and this course is fun and easy with him.

Jim was a great guy, super clear. His exams are easy if you study a bit. He did fill in the blanks for the lecture midterm and final, which were usually pretty easy, with a few tricky ones. The lab material is really closely related to the lecture material, so by studying for one its pretty easy to double up and study for both. Highly recommended!!

Took this in summer of 2012 and it was my most favourite class ever! Material is easy to understand. Midterms were quite easy. Everything was based from his power point notes that you can print out. So glad I got took this class.

Jim is truly a nice guy. He is really clear at explaining the material and connects it well to life outside of school. He encourages questions and is willing to answer questions even before the midterm. He is always on time. Exams are easy if you know your stuff.

This was his first time teaching this course and he was really interesting to listen to!  After a while, I stopped attending class when I realised everything that I had to know was straight from the notes.  His midterms were easy and final was somewhat challenging because every detail had to be known from the notes - such as exact values.
he is a great prof. He gives lots of examples when lecturing and his exams are pure memorization. You must attend the labs in order to do well in this course!

great class if you like excercise...the class is easy just attend labs doesnt matter how fast you run as long as you participate...exams are fair, only downside to this class is that b.c its easy the class average will be high therefore you have to do well on the assignments and tests...when i took it the cut off for a B was 80%
Great professor, cares about his students. Fair, and very clear and concise. Easy to understand.

Jim is an amazing prof! He is extremely helpful and encourages his students. The course was great for both really fit students and those who hate to run!! LOL! The tests were not EASY but manageable and fair. All in all, a great class with a rockin' and good looking prof ;P  Mo, the TA rocked and his hot as well!
Great guy, easy to talk to. Always asks if everything is clear to make sure nobody is leaving confused. Best prof
